title.narrative: Support to Implementation of the Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 (SIBDP2100).

description.narrative:
The main aim of the SIBDP2100 project is to prepare and support the implementation of the Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 by providing Policy Advice (including institutional development, funding strategy, river basin wise implementation programming) and Capacity Building (including communication and stakeholder participation, training, information and knowledge management).
The Bangladesh Delta Plan (BDP) 2100 focuses primarily on adaptation to climate change and on foodsecurity and economic development. The BDP2100 provides a long term vision, goals and strategies, an institutional framework and investment plan. It was formulated from 2014-2018 in a multi sectoral way by the General Economics Division, Planning Commision of the Ministry of Planning, supported by an international consortium led by Dutch consultancy firm Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V. The project was funded by the Government of the Netherlands. BDP2100 was approved by the National Economic Council (NEC), presided over by the Prime Minister and Chairperson of the NEC, on 4 September 2018. Bangladesh is the first country in the world to develop such a comprehensive plan including an investment plan for the entire delta, using Adaptive Delta Management. The Government has assigned the General Economics Division (GED) the responsibility of the overall coordination and facilitation of the BDP 2100 implementation. The Government of the Kingdom of the Netherlands has extended the financial support to operationalize BDP2100 in a TA project, entitled "Support to the Implementation of the Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 (SIBDP2100)". A team of consultants of the SIBDP consortium has been engaged to support GED in its task of initiating and coordinating BDP2100 implementation with other ministries and implementing agencies, with effect from 1 October 2018. The consortium is led by Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V. with consortium partners Deltares and Euroconsult Mott MacDonald and with sub-contractors Institute of Water Modelling (IWM), Center for Environmental and Geographic Information Services (CEGIS) , Climate Adaptation Foundation.

description.narrative: The Inception Report SIBDP 2100 gives an overview of the approach the SIBDP project follows to support implementation of BDP2100. In addition, a Workplan has been elaborated.

The SIBDP Narrative Report 2020 presents activities carried out in 2020 on the 5 implementation capacities SIBDP focuses on for implementation of BDP2100. 3 Case descriptions are presented in the Report to give inside information of the implementation process and challenges.
SIBDP Annual Plan 2021 gives the work plan over 2021. The Report shows what already has been done on support to BDP2100 implementation and builds on this with actions for 2021.

SIBDP Progress & Financial Report 2019 Presents the progress of SIBDP support after 1 year of start up and support to GED on implementation of BDP2100. Besides, a financial statement has been included.

SIBDP support consists of various forms of capacity building. The main focus of the project concerns enhancing the 5 following implementation capacities: 1. Institutional and Administrative Capacity 2. Connective and Organization Capacity 3. Knowledge and Learning Capacity 4. Funding Capacity 5. Natural System Adaptive Capacity
Capacity 2 and 3 have been elaborated in national and international training programme, workshops, fieldtrips as well as building capacity for knowledge management including an Information and Knowledge Portal and Knowledge Agenda.

The SIBDP Narrative Report 2020 gives an overview of activities and delivarables already done or in progress. The Report focuses on 5 implementation capacities. Progress has been summarized on the indicators Policy Advice and Capacity Building.

The SIBDP Annual Plan presents the work packages with activities and delivarables on the 5 implementation capacities planned for 2021. The AP2021 shows a risk analysis and possible measures to be taken. Result indicators have elaborated.

SIBDP provides Policy Advice on many aspects of BDP2100 implementation, e.g. - Institutional arrangements regarding: Delta Wing, top decision making structure of Delta Governance Council, Program/ Project Selection Committee; Project Implementation Committee - Contributing to Delta Fund options and to financing strategy/ generating funding, options for PPP, GCF, O&M cost recovery - Input to GED: 8th Five Year Plan; Medium - Long term consistency - Arrangement for Local/Regional Water Institutions - Climate change updating, in scenario’s, long term approach in programs/ projects - Longer term Delta Goals, Adaptiveness/ Policy Path Ways in 2100 perspective - Holistic and multi sectoral elaborations in programs and projects - Programs/ Projects considering transboundary impact/ relevance
